CommonFields.Title: Effect of Nanofiller Geometry on Network Formation in Polymeric Nanocomposites: Comparison of Rheological and Electrical Properties of Multiwalled Carbon Nanotube and Graphene Nanoribbon
Author: Sadeghi, Soheil
Arjmand, Mohammad
Otero Navas, Ivonne
Zehtab Yazdi, Alireza
Sundararaj, Uttandaraman
CommonFields.Location:
Department of Chemical and
Petroleum Engineering, University of Calgary, 2500 University Dr. NW, Calgary T2N 1N4, Canada

Transmission_Electron_Microscopy.EquipmentUsed: Tecnai TF20 G2 FEG-TEM (FEI, Hillsboro, OR)
Transmission_Electron_Microscopy.Description: HRTEM was carried out on a Tecnai TF20 G2 FEG-TEM (FEI, Hillsboro, OR) at 200 kV acceleration voltage with a standard single-tilt holder.

data.description: broadband electrical conductivity and real permittivity of the nanocomposites

Differential_Scanning_Calorimetry.Description: DSC analyzer equipped with a Refrigerated Cooling System
Differential_Scanning_Calorimetry.CycleInformation:
A first-heating cycle  from room temperature to 240°C 
at heating ramp of 10K/min followed by a first-cooling cycle at a ramp of 10K/min to capture heat of crystallization and crystallization temeprature under N2 atmosphere

data.description: Heat of fusion and crystallization temperature

XRay_Diffraction_and_Scattering.Description: X-ray diffraction (XRD) patterns of the nanofillers were obtained using a Rigaku SmartLab X-ray diffractometer with Cu X-ray tube and a wavelength of 1.540 59 Å.

Thermogravimetric_Analysis.Description: Thermal stability of the nanofillers was evaluated using a thermogravimetric analyzer (TA Instruments, TGA Q500). Samples were heated under an air atmosphere (Praxair AI INDK) from room temperature to 950 °C at a ramp rate of 10 °C/min. Samples were held at 950 °C for 10 min before cooling.

Raman_Spectroscopy.Equipment: WITec Alpha 300 R confocal Raman microscope (WITec GmbH, Germany)
Raman_Spectroscopy.Description:
Raman spectra
were recorded with a WITec Alpha 300 R confocal Raman microscope
(WITec GmbH, Germany) with a laser radiation of 532 nm, integration time of 50 s, 10× objective, and a laser power of 24 mW.

data.description: Small amplitude and large amplitude oscillatory shear data

AC_DielectricDispersion.Description:
the frequency range of 1 Hz−1 MHz according to ASTM D150.
The impedance analyzer was connected to a Solartron 12962 sample holder with an electrode diameter of 10 mm.
The amplitude of the applied voltage was 100 mV (Vrms ∼ 70.71 mV).Prior to the measurements, the electrodes were painted on the compression-molded samples [circular in shae (a thickness of 0.5 mm) with a Carver
compression molder (Carver Inc., Wabash, IN) at 240 °C under 38
MPa pressure for 10 min]  with a silver paste
